summary: Flake said Friday he thought the FBI should decide the scope of the investigation.
A U.S. official briefed on the matter said its not unusual for the White House to set the parameters of an FBI background check for a presidential nominee.
Those details may be pertinent to investigating claims from Ramirez who described an alleged incident of sexual misconduct she said occurred while Kavanaugh was inebriated.
Sen. Chris Coons, D-Del., said Saturday that he supports the week-long scope of the investigation.
The FBI had no choice but to agree to these terms, the sources told NBC News, because it is conducting the background investigation on behalf of the White House.
President Donald Trump said on Saturday that the FBI has "free reign" in the investigation.
"Because having the FBI go out, do a thorough investigation, whether its three days or seven days, I think it’s going to be less than a week.
